alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 9:11AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Suffolk County through 1015 AM EDT... At 910 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles west of Mattituck to Yaphank to near Babylon. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Islip, Brentwood, Commack, Centereach, Shirley, Deer Park, Lindenhurst, Medford, Hauppauge, Ronkonkoma, Manorville, Stony Brook, Babylon, Patchogue and Middle Island. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EDT for southeastern New York.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northwest Suffolk; Southeast Suffolk; Southwest Suffolk
